column1: More good news in the fight against COVID-19. A third vaccine in development looks to be effective and cheaper. Operation Warp Speed is making great strides in making sure we beat this virus. https://t.co/Bjuu8W5IiU

More great news in the fight against COVID-19. A second vaccine showed promising results in early trials with a 94.5% effective rate. Operation Warp Speed and other bipartisan efforts of the Federal government will help our country beat this virus. https://t.co/GB7JBv28gE

The federal government should absolutely provide additional support to families workers small businesses first responders and others but Congress can't do anything until Speaker Pelosi stops her obstruction of an additional COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/jQ7xzD1W4L

This is great news. I'm proud of the bipartisan work the Federal government has done this year in working to find an effective vaccine for COVID-19. We are one step closer to beating this virus and getting back to normal. https://t.co/zCwV5fRTOy

I'm happy to share a virtual tour of the U.S. Capitol for my constituents to enjoy as in-person tours have been cancelled due to COVID-19 restrictions. I hope you find it interesting and informational!  https://t.co/8ECAAqwTEW

Recently I zoomed with leaders at @Illinois_Alma to get an update on the COVID-19 situation on campus and their efforts to obtain FDA Emergency Use Authorization for the rapid saliva-based test they developed. I let them know I stand ready to assist in any way possible. https://t.co/oo3RLqNd8K

Earlier this week I met with leaders from @NormalILL @IllinoisStateU and @McLeanHealth to get an update on the COVID-19 situation on campus and in the community. I appreciated their insights. I continue to monitor the situation across IL-13 and advocate for necessary resources. https://t.co/0ApKMAzyXf

Caught up with the leaders at @ChestnutHealth to discuss the #COVID19 pandemic and efforts to expand access to primary behavioral and dental care in the area. Chestnut is in the top 3% of Federally Qualified Health Centers for care quality - hats off to the healthcare workers! https://t.co/uT77V0o70R

ICYMI: AgCreate in Monticello putting $100k @USDA COVID grant to use.  “Agriculture has been impacted in many ways by this pandemic and this grant will allow AgCreate in partnership with USDA to be part of addressing this particular issue.” Read more:  https://t.co/3E81RUmAlz

ICYMI: “...one thing we haven’t forgotten about at the federal level is to work in a bipartisan way to make sure there is funding to prepare people who are now out of work because of COVID to get back into the workforce during the pandemic.”  https://t.co/35TjMJCOaQ

My family and I send our prayers and well wishes to President Trump and the First Lady for a speedy recovery from COVID-19. As someone who contracted the virus and recovered I know the strain it can put on your loved ones and work colleagues. https://t.co/2qc9jL8HmS

My bill will protect construction jobs & provide much-needed cash to ensure state highway projects continue as planned. As we consider another COVID relief package we must include additional relief for state DOTs so we can continue to invest in our nation’s infrastructure.

The COVID-19 pandemic has put great financial strain on state govt budgets including state DOTs. That's why I'm introducing the Highway Relief Act which empowers the US DOT Secretary to fund up to 100% of highway projects.  Learn more about my bill here: https://t.co/q1XSKBtxup

The plasma donating process was quick and easy. I encourage anyone who has recovered from #COVID19 and meets the donation criteria to consider making a convalescent plasma donation. Visit https://t.co/KUTC0zPXWb to learn more.

Today I donated convalescent plasma at @WillYouGive's Central IL Community Blood Center in Springfield to potentially aid others who are battling #COVID19. The antibodies found in the plasma of recoverees like me could possibly help others in their fight against the disease. https://t.co/SSvLeIzIA0

USDA @SecretarySonny visited #IL13 earlier this week. We were able to see firsthand how the Farmers to Families Food Box program is helping families during this pandemic and also talk with local farmers about COVID-19's impact on the #IL ag economy. https://t.co/Tb5SSvZGVW

Next week my staff will be in Edinburg Benld Kincaid and Warrensburg hosting Traveling Help Desks. If you need assistance come on out or you can always call any of my offices and we can help you over the phone. COVID-19 precautions will be in place. We're here to serve you. https://t.co/Yl6NVDje4Y

Next week my staff will be in Morrisonville Macon and Cerro Gordo hosting Traveling Help Desks. If you need assistance come on out or you can always call any of my offices and we can help you over the phone. COVID-19 precautions will be in place. We're here to serve you. https://t.co/m6zY4XGS8j

Airports have been hard hit by the Coronavirus pandemic as travel for both business and leisure slows down. This additional CARES Act grant will completely remove the local share for this project making it 100% federally funded. https://t.co/dio3MvLwGa

This is great news. Abbott's new antigen test just received emergency FDA use authorization. These tests will help us get COVID-19 under control and greatly expand our nation's testing capacity. https://t.co/3vZtheMU2k

Over 3 months ago I sent a letter to leaders of my own party urging them to include federal assistance to USPS including the $25 billion appropriation that’s now being discussed in additional COVID-19 relief legislation. You can find that letter here: https://t.co/oAMzcXpf1x

Wrapped up my August Open Office Hours today in Godfrey. We held 14 events in all 14 counties of IL-13. Some were in person while others were virtual due to my COVID quarantine. We helped dozens with the federal bureaucracy and I look forward to taking what I learned back to DC. https://t.co/YGx7SYk7wf

Following my doctor's advice and in accordance with CDC guidelines I have exited my Coronavirus quarantine. It was great to see folks at my Taylorville Open Office Hours. Thanks to those who came out to share what was on their mind or seek assistance. https://t.co/Rr6yGa2Ibm

My personal COVID-19 experience has reinforced the need to focus on our personal responsibility to our neighbors and our communities. That’s what it will take to protect the public health get our economy going again and get us through this pandemic. https://t.co/xX43o4pdcD

Health centers like SIU's Center for Family Medicine & other health care providers are on the front lines of fighting the COVID-19 pandemic. That’s why I joined a near-unanimous group in supporting critical relief for providers but more needs to be done. https://t.co/zoK65XkHHr

Next week I'll be holding Virtual Open Office Hours in 4 communities across 4 counties. I'm committed to serving my constituents virtually from home while I quarantine after testing positive for Coronavirus. COVID-19 precautions will be in place. See below for more details. https://t.co/FVzU8vbbZx

It was great to be able to talk with constituents from home during my Virtual Open Office Hours this week in Rochester Hillsboro and Sorento after testing positive for Coronavirus. It was good to hear their thoughts on many issues. I appreciated all the well wishes too! https://t.co/2jum3mf4jv

This morning I tested positive for COVID-19. I will continue to serve my constituents and #IL13 virtually from home while I quarantine and until I receive a negative test.  Read my full statement here: https://t.co/0uUTXgWUlu

Enjoyed meeting with constituents in Monticello and Tolono today during my Open Office Hours. Was able to help several constituents with issues they were having with federal agencies and heard their thoughts on issues ranging from the Coronavirus pandemic to local projects. https://t.co/HJxAwSeOqf

I’ll be in 6 communities across 6 counties this coming week just call the number listed to make an appointment. It’s always been a priority of mine to make sure constituents have an opportunity to be heard or get the help they need. COVID-19 precautions will be in place. https://t.co/umSDiEssbe

We continue to hear from local leaders across #IL who are struggling because of COVID-19 and the Governor’s stay-at-home orders. The public deserves to know how their federal tax $ that's being withheld by the Governor will be disbursed because this relief $ is critically needed.

New data shows that as of June 30 the State of Illinois has only spent roughly 14% of the federal COVID-19 relief funding allocated by Congress. It's time for Governor Pritzker to be transparent about how he is withholding critical relief funds. https://t.co/4u4OSWV2PE

Need help with a federal agency and prefer to meet in-person? My staff will be in 7 communities this coming week just call to make an appointment. COVID-19 precautions will be in place - learn more below. We can always assist you over the phone as well. https://t.co/CZInpIs90c

Need help with a federal agency and prefer to meet in-person? My staff will be in 6 communities this coming week just call to make an appointment. COVID-19 precautions will be in place - learn more below. We can always assist you over the phone as well. https://t.co/Au6SBHueVO

From Monday July 20 through Sunday July 26 there will be a mobile COVID-19 testing site in Hillsboro. This is open to anyone who wishes to be tested. Appointments are not necessary. There is no fee for testing as well. More information can be found in the flyer below. https://t.co/tG82I093nv

Many families I represent can only return to work if they have access to affordable child care. That's why I teamed up with @RepTomEmmer and 39 other lawmakers in supporting additional relief for child care providers in future COVID-19 relief legislation. https://t.co/3V2zGrTGOt

This Congress I’ve teamed up with Dems and Republicans on bills to ensure access to health care for out-of-work Americans protect nurses from furloughs investigate our response to COVID-19 and more.   Learn more about my bipartisan legislation here: https://t.co/iryhEPWYp4

I'm proud to receive the "Spirit of Enterprise" award from the @USChamber for my bipartisan record of supporting legislation that boosts the #IL13 economy. In this COVID-19 pandemic we should be doing everything we can to support #SmallBiz and grow jobs. https://t.co/aBmPNFr7PO

The COVID-19 pandemic has forced millions of Americans out of work putting their access to health care at risk. That's why I worked with lawmakers from both parties to introduce the Health Care Protection Act.  Read my op-ed on our legislation here: https://t.co/jq9Wfpqda0 #IL13 https://t.co/hT3asG5WbK

Yesterday I visited @LibmanCompany in Arcola. Last year they spent over $9 million in non-payroll expenses on suppliers support and other services in IL-13 communities. The work they do manufacturing cleaning supplies is especially important during #Covid19. https://t.co/rWnvKFFWGr

I am committed to expanding access to affordable health care for #IL13 families especially during this COVID-19 pandemic. That's why I'm working with lawmakers from both parties on this critical issue.  Learn more about my legislation here: https://t.co/D8Gnddg4Wt https://t.co/FZdc3jukSm

Today I teamed up with the @UAW @JohnDeere and @IMA_Today to help deliver face shields to first responders and nursing homes in Taylorville and Springfield. PPE like this is vital to limiting the spread of Coronavirus. Thanks to John Deere for the donations to these facilities! https://t.co/xTWx7YGfx5

I recently signed a bipartisan letter to House leadership urging them to include #COVID19 relief for National Heritage Areas including the Abraham Lincoln NHA in a future recovery bill. This action followed a request from @Looking4Lincoln. Read more:  https://t.co/b2DOCZ8JtO
ICYMI: I recently announced COVID-19 funding to the @MaconCo_Sheriff McLean County Sheriff's Office and @Sang_Sheriff. Learn more from @wandtvnews. https://t.co/3r871TpHMP

Seniors who become unemployed due to the coronavirus pandemic may qualify for a Medicare Part B special enrollment period. Click here to learn more and apply: https://t.co/dHaRZCwcxs…/medicare-part-b-online-application/

This weekend June 5-7 is @ASPCA National Adoption Weekend. Adoptions are down to COVID-19 and many animals need homes. Search for a participating shelter or rescue near you: https://t.co/4zTjITjthx https://t.co/ttV3dlnIsu
ICYMI: Recently I announced a $153465 grant from @TheJusticeDept the @champaigncity to assist with the coronavirus response. More from @foxillinois:  https://t.co/knYrHTMdbt

The @ccountychamber is hosting HIRED Series: Navigating the Job Market Post-Coronavirus. These online sessions are free and open to anyone. They run from 8:30 - 9:30 a.m. beginning June 4 and will continue each Thursday through the month of June. More:  https://t.co/gQ49agZlEJ
Three new #Covid_19  testing sites in or near IL-13 at @CVSHealth drive-thru locations - Alton Decatur and Savoy. Read more below: https://t.co/WGlb9P4mI1
Congress and President Trump have delivered for the State of Illinois when it comes to PPE for the #COVID19Pandemic. See for yourself below: https://t.co/jlPSulp3Pu

ICYMI: @belkin announced that they are producing an emergency ventilator based on the RapidVent concept developed by researchers at @Illinois_Alma. Proud of the work being done at the U of I to address the #CoronavirusPandemic.  https://t.co/UKkp4xVwXu

This week the​ @NSF awarded $682662 to five COVID-19 related research projects at the @Illinois_Alma​. Three of the grants are specifically aimed at shortening the amount of time it takes to process COVID-19 tests. Read more at the link: https://t.co/h2yaW7NEEO https://t.co/MYaXncj8rH

I joined @TulsiPress today to introduce the Nurse Workforce Protection Act to prevent health care providers who receive COVID-19 relief from furloughing nurses. We are co-chairs of the House Nursing Caucus. Read more here: https://t.co/SeX0ueu1fE

May is #MentalHealthAwareness Month. Below are tips from the @CDCgov to cope with #COVID19 stress: 1. PAUSE. Breathe. Notice how you feel 2. TAKE BREAKS from COVID-19 content 3. MAKE TIME to sleep and exercise 4. REACH OUT and stay connected 5. SEEK HELP if overwhelmed or unsafe https://t.co/pLySUb8KPs

Yesterday I announced that @HHSGov has awarded $2053494 to six health centers in IL-13 to expand #Covid19 testing capacity. The funding comes from the most recent coronavirus relief legislation that I voted for and @POTUS signed into law.  https://t.co/p5Cg1QiU12

As the husband of a nurse I have a special appreciation for the care they provide day in and day out. Today is #NationalNursesDay launching #NationalNursesWeek  where we say THANK YOU. Our combined gratitude is especially timely as they combat the coronavirus. #ThankANurse https://t.co/nntapuWrff
Great to have you on Rich! Look forward to working with you and @ILFarmBureau members as we navigate the impacts of #COVID19. https://t.co/9FOy7NB2tQ

Yesterday I was joined by over 7000 constituents on my #COVID19 Tele-Town Hall with @repdanbrady. Thanks for all of the questions on unemployment small business relief testing reopening our economy and more. For more coronavirus-related resources: https://t.co/IRjIXtjZcl https://t.co/F4Tr13K1X7
Tune in to this Facebook Live tomorrow at 12:00pm CST w/ @chefjoseandres @RepSwalwell on Restaurants and Food Insecurity during #COVID19. https://t.co/XwvQ2b00fF

I’m working to ensure that workers like those @GoIUPAT don’t lose access to their health insurance during the #COVID19 pandemic at no fault of their own. Layoffs and uncertainty abound during this crisis and health care access shouldn’t be another worry of my constituents.

The Democratic leadership in Illinois wants to use #COVID19 pandemic as an excuse to seek a $10 billion federal bailout of Illinois’ already troubled pension funds. This defies common sense. You can read more here from the @Suntimes: https://t.co/EYxxx3wPbH
We @TransportGOP and @TransportDems say THANK YOU #ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving as our nation combats the #COVID19 pandemic. Our supply chain keeps moving because of you: 🚌🚚🚆🚂✈🚢 https://t.co/JbVDlP1OJ6
ICYMI: More from @SJRbreaking on the new @Walgreens COVID-19 testing site in Springfield.  https://t.co/zKWETdar1g

Today I visited the new @Walgreens COVID-19 testing facility in Springfield with @RepLaHood @RepTimButler and Rep. Mike Murphy. They opened up last Friday. Looking to get tested? Visit this site to learn more: https://t.co/bOSBmKA4cZ https://t.co/lRHRfuupzR

If you've got #COVID19 questions their is a good chance we have answers at https://t.co/IRjIXtBA3T. If you can't find what you're looking for you can call any of my offices or send an e-mail through by website. We stand ready to assist.

ICYMI: This week I announced #CARESAct funding for local airports to offset #COVID19 losses and save jobs.  ✈️St. Louis Regional Airport $69000 ✈️Central IL Regional Airport $4632066 ✈️Decatur Airport $17494522 ✈️Litchfield Municipal Airport $30000
We cannot say THANK YOU enough to our doctors nurses first responders and others on the front lines of the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/YTah9mn8Nq

People across America are coming together to do their part to combat the coronavirus. Read some of these stories including one on @Carle_org / @Illinois_Alma ventilator partnership by clicking below. #AmericaWorksTogether https://t.co/rgbVGJmhOB

ICYMI: COVID-19 testing will continue in McLean County through May. There are no residency restrictions. Currently anyone 16+ with symptoms can get tested here. Healthcare workers and first responders can get tested even without displaying symptoms. https://t.co/5fJDaGa9sj

The weekend is starting and your probably deciding what to do for dinner. No matter your food choice I encourage you to #supportlocal restaurants. After dinner go online and buy from local businesses. They need all of our support right now due to the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/s7zMJzhgVL

I was glad to be able to thank our @IL_Natl_Guard serving at the McLean Co COVID-19 testing site in person today & announce federal funding will be extended through May 30th until it can be transitioned to a state-managed facility. https://t.co/4og60yVLbn
It's important that we continue to #SlowTheSpread by following @POTUS & @CDCgov Coronavirus Guidelines for America. https://t.co/dNd7BhKOEN

My #COVID19 resource page has information on: ☑️Direct Payments for Americans ☑️Relief for Small Businesses ☑️Expanded Benefits for the Unemployed ☑️Healthcare for the Unemployed  Check it out ⬇️ https://t.co/lAhl4EZ37q
On #WorldHealthDay2020 we salute the doctors nurses first responders and all others on the front lines treating the patients of the #COVID19Pandemic. https://t.co/50EATlyH3Z

We've assisted many constituents with #COVID19 international travel issues. We're working with the @StateDept to get Dr. Orakzai and several other constituents home in a difficult environment. https://t.co/m3kzYkotga

Like many of the people living in them #IL13 small towns & cities are struggling financially because of Coronavirus. In addition to helping the American people Congress also passed funding to help our small towns & cities. https://t.co/YBICXcFfWx
ICYMI: Bloomington-Normal others get coronavirus funding through federal relief money https://t.co/4QrQhwRPDr via @pantagraph
Questions about the federal coronavirus relief legislation? Ask me: https://t.co/QdOFK9v1b6 via @heraldandreview

CDBG Disaster Recovery grants for #COVID19 are flowing this week to communities across my district:  @cityblm $329144 @champaigncity $591549 @AccessDecatur $834287 @madisoncountyil $1755949 @NormalILL $246067 @Springfield_IL $799156 @cityofurbana $294966

The federal government is working quickly to implement the coronavirus relief package we passed last week. I've heard from local officials about the need for federal funding to deal with a wide-range coronavirus pandemic impacts.  https://t.co/GEp64awfWW

Today I announced that my 2020 Congressional Art Competition deadline has been extended and e-submission procedures put in place due to #COVID19. Students may do their artwork independently at home. For details click below:  https://t.co/n0BYxJfZbY https://t.co/SJyIVnw4wF

I flew back to DC for the vote on the CARES Act or Phase 3 of our efforts to help Americans struggling due to #COVID19. If there's one thing the federal govt should come together on it's helping our country during a crisis. #InItTogether Watch 📺 https://t.co/X72RIhACCq

The @USDOL now has answers to your questions on how the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (Phase 2) paid sick leave and expanded FMLA provisions will work. Whether you're an employee or employer go check this out: https://t.co/5KBdS4H1yW https://t.co/TJZ1bNUfq7

I know we have businesses who want to help and I continue to hear from hospitals who are worried about a shortage of medical supplies to treat Coronavirus. I joined a group of bipartisan members of Congress to ask President Trump to utilize the Defense Production Act.

Speaker Pelosi is proposing a bill that includes many policies unrelated to the Coronavirus pandemic. We need to pass a bill that focuses every effort on providing relief to Americans & businesses struggling not one party's political wishlist.

Attention Small Businesses: If you missed my conference call with @SBA_Illinois this morning you can find it on my website along with other SBA resources. Simply go to the Small Business section of my coronavirus information page: https://t.co/lAhl4EZ37q https://t.co/7leVnAy3eZ

This morning I talked with @WMBDNews while moving my twin boys out of their dorm at @IllinoisStateU. Anxious parents disappointed students and a local economy that will miss them. We're working in Congress to provide relief to those impacted by the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/qZwM8t3ZjQ

Coronavirus is causing many changes and with that comes questions. My website has useful links to official trusted sources of information. The situation changes daily and the links provided will keep you up-to-date. Link below to check it out.  https://t.co/lAhl4EZ37q

I've been chatting with health care providers across the district this week and this is one thing the state can do to immediately free up personal protective equipment (PPE) so it's available for tests and treatment of Coronavirus patients. https://t.co/gomTmzNK6D

Joined the @WillYouGive @RepTimButler and Rep. Mike Murphy to launch the #GiveGloodChallenge. Blood collections are down by 60% due to coronavirus. I challenge my fellow Members of Congress and those who can safely do so to donate. Visit: https://t.co/nP7lnz3Dbw for more info. https://t.co/yGknT6HvkT

State @repdanbrady and I discussed with @Pantagraph about helping businesses and employees weather the impact of Coronavirus. We have to make sure people have the help they need now but also jobs to come back to. https://t.co/KQmmXZwrR6

Yesterday I sat down with leaders of Carlinville Area Hospital to discuss the rapidly evolving coronavirus pandemic. Small rural hospitals need our support and I'll be working on their behalf to make sure they have what they need to treat their patients. https://t.co/D9bVmv9ejd
Follow this guidance from the CDC and White House to do your part to slow the spread of Coronavirus ⬇️ https://t.co/NfnFJS90SU

The @IllinoisDCEO needs to hear from small business owners negatively impacted by coronavirus. The information will be used to help Illinois get federal funds from @SBAgov. Form here: https://t.co/hJ6OsZU6Ma
The @DHSgov has released further guidance related to coronavirus related travel restrictions: https://t.co/WV3FiCbtGo https://t.co/GBn5jcWzeI

Last night Congress and President Trump reached a bipartisan deal to provide free testing protect our most vulnerable and offer relief to Americans who may experience economic hardship because of the coronavirus. Read my full statement: https://t.co/6Fv3Fw0COJ

Thank you to the @weatherchannel for working with us to provide information about the Coronavirus to our constituents. For more information please visit https://t.co/ZITbUR2eDv. https://t.co/wRlCj6UeZK
For the latest information on COVID-19 (coronavirus) I urge you to visit the @CDCgov website: https://t.co/4VZDfqBYMl
Just Announced: Illinois will receive almost $17.5 Million from the CDC to fight the coronavirus the majority of which is from the emergency supplemental we passd last week. https://t.co/6RXD9VW7sg
HAPPENING NOW: updating everyone on what we’re doing to ensure staff visitors and others are prepared and what we’re doing to stop the spread of Coronavirus on the Hill. https://t.co/H4u8EaAXDN
I'll be providing an update as Ranking Member of @HouseAdmnGOP on House preparations and guidance we've provided offices for dealing with Coronavirus. Be sure to tune in! https://t.co/rc2jHbv75N
@POTUS My listening session with health professionals from the #IL13 to discuss preparedness and what they need from the govt to stop Coronavirus has started. WATCH live here: https://t.co/IC9uqAl4en

@POTUS just signed the bill we passed to provide funding to help prevent treat and research the Coronavirus. Please visit CDC's website to get facts about the illness how to prevent it and what to do if you exhibit symptoms: https://t.co/4VZDfqBYMl https://t.co/IIoo2ODJZt
I just voted for funding to prevent the spread of Coronavirus help treat those with the illness & research & develop vaccines. https://t.co/jiHdP4Yu41

February is #AmericanHeartMonth. Coronary heart disease (CHD) affects 574000 people in Illinois. Nationally someone dies of CHD every 1.4 minutes. Join me and @TheHeartTruth & let others know there’s a lot we can do to keep our hearts healthy. https://t.co/5K81ayrz02 https://t.co/YKfL6RUMbU
